<h1 class="c14" id="h.gjdgxs"><span class="c11 c55">TRADEMARK RULES & BRAND GUIDELINES</span></h1>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">General</span></h2>
<p><span>The BeagleBoard.org Foundation is dedicated to providing education in and promotion of the design and use of open-source software and hardware in embedded computing. As part of this, we provide open-source software (e.g., firmware and/or operating system source code) and open-source hardware designs (e.g., schematics and PCB layouts) for our devices.  The BeagleBoard.org brand and trademarks belongs to the BeagleBoard.org Foundation and include:</span></p>
</br>
<ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_7-0 start" start="1"><li><span>The following logos:</span></li></ol><a id="t.2d5e5f150e484bdbf71143db4fbf7d7f8691ad87"></a><a id="t.0"></a>

  <ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_7-0" start="2"><li class="c26 c29"><span class="c5">The </span><span>words </span><span class="c5">BeagleBoard.org, BeagleBoard, </span><span>PocketBeagle, </span><span class="c5">& BeagleBone</span></li></ol><p class="c26"><span class="c5">Acceptable use of the BeagleBoard.org brand is outlined below.           </span></p><p class="c26"><span class="c1">When to Use</span></p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_6-0 start" start="1"><li class="c4"><span class="c5">In connection with the sale and distribution of official BeagleBoard.org products</span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_6-1 start" start="1"><li class="c58 c44 c46"><span class="c5">When used in this way the logo or trademark must link to our website www.beagleboard.org</span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_6-0" start="2"><li class="c26 c29"><span class="c5">In a way that highlights your connection with BeagleBoard.org such as referencing an accessory youve created for the BeagleBoard.org product range</span></li></ol><p class="c26"><span class="c1">How NOT to use the brand</span></p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_5-0 start" start="1"><li class="c4"><span class="c5">In any way that would give the false impression you are endorsed by BeagleBoard.org without prior consent</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">Owning and using a d</span><span class="c5">omain names containing BeagleBoard or BeagleBone</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">In a false or derogatory light</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">To manufacture, sell or give away merchandise</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">In any way that will take advantage of our brand and reputation</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">In a similar but subtly different way</span></li><li class="c26 c29"><span class="c5">Associating the brand with false or counterfeit products</span></li></ol><p class="c26"><span class="c1">What else should I know?</span></p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_14-0 start" start="1"><li class="c4"><span class="c5">For non-BeagleBoard.org materials, if our brand is referenced your business name, brand, and product should take the most prominent position</span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">When referencing any of the official BeagleBoard.org products, such as BeagleBone Black, BeagleBoard.org must always be included as the first part of the naming convention.   </span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_14-1 start" start="1"><li class="c44 c46 c58"><span class="c5">In this example the correct naming convention is BeagleBoard.org BeagleBone Black.</span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_14-0" start="3"><li class="c4"><span class="c5">Both Bs in any registered version of the BeagleBone or BeagleBoard text should always be capitalized. </span></li><li class="c4"><span class="c5">The should never be used in front of any BeagleBoard.org reference.  </span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_14-1 start" start="1"><li class="c26 c44"><span class="c5">The BeagleBoard.org PocketBeagle would be incorrect.  BeagleBoard.org PocketBeagle is correct.</span></li></ol>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">Logo</span></h2><p class="c26"><span class="c5">The following guidelines are examples specific to the BeagleBoard.org logo but apply to the BeagleBoard.org Embedded, BeagleBoard.org Compatible, and BeagleBoard.org Approved logos.</span></p><p class="c26"><span class="c3">Minimum Sizing</span></p><a id="t.235f0a0a2d6659281166cf29ab0804ce266eef70"></a><a id="t.1"></a><table class="c56"><tbody><tr class="c36"><td class="c45" colspan="1" rowspan="1"><p class="c16"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 310.67px; height: 58.93px;"><img alt="http://beagleboard.org/static/images/beagleboard_org_logo.png" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/BrandingImages/branding_height.PNG" style="width: 310.67px; margin-left: -0.00px; margin-top: -0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 24.20px; height: 1.33px;"><img alt="" src="/static/tm2/images/image7.png" style="width: 24.20px; height: 1.33px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p></td><td class="c89" colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br><p class="c31 c28"><span class="c5"></span></p><p class="c31"><span>The height must be a minimum of 12mm/45px</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p class="c26"><span class="c3">Spacing</span></p>
<table class="c56"><tbody><tr class="c36"><td class="c45" colspan="1" rowspan="1"><p class="c31"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 310.67px; height: 100.93px;"><img alt="http://beagleboard.org/static/images/beagleboard_org_logo.png" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/BrandingImages/branding_spacing.PNG" style="width: 310.67px; margin-left: -0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; margin-bottom: 30.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 24.20px; height: 1.33px;"></span></p></td><td class="c89" colspan="1" rowspan="1"><p><span><br>As respect for the logo There must be adequate spacing on all sides to ensure no interference with other colors, graphics, images, etc</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p class="c26"><span class="c3">Color Palette<br></span><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 678.50px; height: 396.73px;"><img alt="" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/BrandingImages/branding_colorpalette.PNG" style="width: 678.50px;  margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p>
<p class="c26"><span class="c3">Typeface</span></p><p class="c26"><span class="c5">Gotham Round is the primary font used for BeagleBoard.org and is available in the following weights and styles:<br><br></span><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 705.50px; height: 172.46px;"><img alt="" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/BrandingImages/branding_typeface.PNG" style="width: 705.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p>
<p class="c26"><span class="c3">Restrictions </span></p><p class="c26"><span class="c1">Do not</span></p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_8-0 start" start="1"><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Rotate the logo</span></li><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Separate the dog image from BeagleBoard.org text</span></li><li class="c46 c51"><span class="c5">Change the color scheme</span></li><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Repositions elements of the logo</span></li><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Adjust sizing without proportional scale</span></li><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Add visual effects like shadows or gradients</span></li><li class="c51 c46"><span class="c5">Add too or remove elements of the dog design </span></li></ol>
<img alt="" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/BrandingImages/branding_restrictions_v2.PNG" style="width: 705.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title="">

  </span></p></td><td class="c95" colspan="1" rowspan="1"><p class="c31"><span class="c27"><a class="c8" href="#h.3znysh7">BeagleBoard.org Approved Program</a></span><span class="c5">.</span></p><p class="c31"><span>Partners in this program are authorized to manufacture and sell peripheral devices for official products of BeagleBoard.org under their own brand. Partners in this program are licensed to manufacture and sell official BeagleBoard.org products.  </span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><hr style="page-break-before:always;display:none;"><p class="c26 c28"><span class="c6 c65 c49 c90"></span></p><h2 class="c46 c62" id="h.30j0zll"><span class="c68 c11">BeagleBoard.org Embedded Program</span></h2>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c79">What is it</span></h2><p><span><img alt="http://beagleboard.org/static/images/beagle_approved.png" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/logo/beagleboard-embedded/beaglebaord-embedded.svg" style="float: right; width: 125px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 20px;" title="">Partners in this program are companies or individuals that use an official BeagleBoard.org product as part of their design or end product.  Examples include using BeagleBoard.org BeagleBone Black as the embedded system in a gateway or industrial tablet.  Partners in this program will be authorized to use the BeagleBoard.org Embedded logo on their product or product packaging.</span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14" id="h.1fob9te"><span class="c11 c25">How to join</span></h2><p><span>Start by filling out the request form </span><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://forms.gle/J1k4kejc634ou53V8&sa=D&ust=1558459985275000">here</a></span><spa>. Note that you will need to include product images as part of the request.  Once submitted someone from the BeagleBoard.org team will reach out to confirm whether or not youve been approved.</spa>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">Specific Branding Guidelines</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-0 start" start="1"><li class="c53 c29 c46"><span>All guidelines for BeagleBoard.orgs brand apply to participants of this program.  </span></li><li class="c24"><span>Principles of those guidelines apply to the use of the BeagleBoard.org Embedded logo on your product packaging and product itself.</span></li><li class="c29 c46 c66"><span>Promotion and marketing of an embedded product must be done so under your brand referencing your association with the BeagleBoard.org Foundation through the Embedded program.</span></li></ol>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">What products are part of this program today?</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_4-0 start" start="1"><li class="c24"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.phenixtech.com/&sa=D&ust=1558459985276000">Phenix Technologies</a></span></li></ol><hr style="page-break-before:always;display:none;"><p class="c26 c28"><span class="c2"></span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c62 c46"><span class="c68 c11">BeagleBoard.org Compatible Program</span></h2>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">What is it</span></h2><p class="c22"><span><img alt="" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/logo/beagleboard-compatible/beagleboard-compatible.svg" style="float: right; width: 120px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 20px;" title="">Suppliers part of this program are interested in a licensing agreement with BeagleBoard.org that will allow them to develop a derivative of an official BeagleBoard.org product (e.g., a product from the BeagleBoard, BeagleBone, and PocketBeagle product families) under their own brand.  The BeagleBoard.org team will support the supplier where appropriate throughout the development, launch, and ongoing promotion of the product.  We are here to help ensure your success!</span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14" id="h.rgw5hl5wwcgw"><span class="c25 c11">How to join</span></h2><p class="c26"><span>Start by filling out the request form </span><span><a  href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://forms.gle/J1k4kejc634ou53V8&sa=D&ust=1558459985277000">here</a></span><span>. Once youve submitted your request the BeagleBoard.org team will reach out to discuss next steps including establishing a license agreement to ensure the below T&Cs are met, aligning on the products details, and overall timeline for launch.  </span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c79">Terms and Conditions</span></h2>
<p><span>BeagleBoard Compatible" is defined as a circuit board that:<br><br></span></p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-0 start" start="1"><li class="c29 c46"><span>Is manufactured from a modified version of the hardware design of an official BeagleBoard.org product</span></li><li class="c29"><span>Fully supports and ships with an installed copy of a version of software designated by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation for an official BeagleBoard.org product</span></li><li class="c29 c46"><span>Has been tested by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation (or its designated representative(s)) and has passed the testing;</span></li><li class="c29 c46"><span>Includes source code and hardware design that is released using one or more open source licenses approved by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation<br><br></span></li></ol>
<p><span>You also agree to indemnify and defend the BeagleBoard.org Foundation against any claim arising out of the circuit board.  </span></p>
<p class="c22">Additionally, while the BeagleBoard.org team will work with the supplier to ensure the products success, all aspects of product ownership are the suppliers sole responsibility. These standards include, but are not limited to:</p><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_18-0 start" start="1"><li class="c29 c46"><span>Accessories (which we encourage!) and the applicability for use with this product </span></li><li class="c24"><span>Specific hardware support such as product failures, RMAs, etc</span></li><li class="c24"><span>Manufacturing and associated quality</span></li><li class="c24"><span>Product compliance</span></li><li class="c66 c29 c46"><span>An entry in our EEPROM database recorded in a Github-hosted </span><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://github.com/beagleboard/image-builder/blob/master/readme.md&sa=D&ust=1558459985279000">readme.md</a></span><span> file.</span></li></ol><p><span>General support for a board in this program will be available from the BeageBoard.org community specific and again, the BeagleBoard.org team is here to help ensure the products success!</span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">Specific Branding Guidelines</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-0 start" start="1"><li class="c29 c46"><span>All guidelines for BeagleBoard.orgs brand apply to participants of this program.  </span></li><li class="c24"><span>Principles of those guidelines apply to the use of the BeagleBoard.org Compatible logo</span></li><li class="c24"><span>This logo will not be separately used with any peripherals without the express approval of the BeagleBoard.org Foundation.</span></li><li class="c24"><span>Promotion and marketing of an approved product must be done so under your brand reference your association with the BeagleBoard.org Foundation</span></li></ol><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-1 start" start="1"><li class="c66 c44 c46"><span>As an example, you are NOT authorized to use any official BeagleBoard.org logo on the products PCB silk screen</span></li></ol>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">What products are part of this program today?</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-0 start" start="1"><li class="c29 c46"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://beagleboard.org/green&sa=D&ust=1558459985281000">SeeedStudio BeagleBone Green</a></span></li><li class="c24"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://beagleboard.org/green-wireless&sa=D&ust=1558459985281000">SeeedStudio BeagleBone Green Wireless</a></span></li><li class="c66 c29 c46"><span ><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://beagleboard.org/enhanced&sa=D&ust=1558459985282000">SanCloud BeagleBone Enhanced</a></span></li></ol><hr style="page-break-before:always;display:none;">
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c62 c46"><span class="c75 c11">BeagleBoard.org Approved Program</span></h2>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">What is it</span></h2><p><img alt="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/logo/beagleboard-approved/beagleboard-approved.png" src="http://beagleboard.org/static/tm2/images/image4.png" style="float: right; width: 300px; margin: -10px 0px 0px 20px;" title="">Partners in this program are authorized to manufacture and sell peripheral devices for official products of BeagleBoard.org (e.g., a product from the BeagleBoard, BeagleBone, and PocketBeagle product families) under their own brand. An example of a product in this program is the <a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.element14.com/community/docs/DOC-81966/l/43-lcd-display-cape-for-beaglebone-black&sa=D&ust=1558459985283000">element14 LCD Display Cape.</a> </p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14" id="h.b2lutvd3o6ma"><span class="c25 c11">How to join</span></h2>
<p><span>Start by filling out the request form </span><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://forms.gle/J1k4kejc634ou53V8&sa=D&ust=1558459985283000">here</a></span>
  <span>.</span><span> There's no charge for being "BeagleBoard.org Approved", just a verification that needs to happen. If your product is of good quality and compatibility, we want people to know to use it!</span></p>
<p><span>Once youve submitted your request the BeagleBoard.org team will reach out to review your proposal and ensure the following T&Cs are been met.</span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">Terms and Conditions</span></h2><p class="c14">
  <span>For a peripheral device to be eligible for a license for this trademark, the below requirements must be fulfilled.  The official BeagleBoard.org product with which a BeagleBoard Approved peripheral device is intended to be used will be referred to as an accessorized product:</span></p>
<ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-0 start" start="1"><li class="c24"><span>The peripheral device has been tested by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation (or its designated representative(s)) for use with the accessorized product and has passed the testing</span></li>
  <li class="c24"><span>The peripheral device has been determined by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation (or its designated representative(s)) to provide a satisfactory out-of-box experience for users for use with the accessorized product</span></li>
  <li class="c24"><span>All source code and/or hardware design for the peripheral device must be released using one or more open source licenses approved by the BeagleBoard.org Foundation</span></li>
  <li class="c24"><span>If a license is granted for the peripheral device, any future revised version of the peripheral device must be approved by BeagleBoard.org before the BeagleBoard.org Approved logo may be used in connection with the revised version.</span></li></ol>
  <ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-1 start" start="1"><li class="c24 c46 c44"><span>If any software is required to support your product, you'll also need to ensure its default image is built by </span>
    <span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://bit.ly/beagle-image-builder&sa=D&ust=1558459985285000">http://bit.ly/beagle-image-builder</a></span><span class="c9 c11">.</span></li></ol>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">Specific Branding Guidelines</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_2dniuznnf4b0-0 start" start="1"><li class="24"><span>All guidelines for BeagleBoard.orgs brand apply to participants of this program.  </span></li>
  <li class="c24"><span>Principles of those guidelines apply to the use of the BeagleBoard.org Approved logo</span></li>
  <li class="c24"><span>Promotion and marketing of an approved product must be done so under your brand reference your association with the BeagleBoard.org Foundation</span></li></ol>
<ol class="c21 lst-kix_list_15-1 start" start="1"><li class="c66 c44 c46"><span>The </span><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.element14.com/community/docs/DOC-81966/l/43-lcd-display-cape-for-beaglebone-black&sa=D&ust=1558459985285000">element14 LCD Display Cape for BeagleBone Black</a></span><span> is a good example</span></li></ol>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c14"><span class="c25 c11">What products are approved today?</span></h2><ol class="c21 lst-kix_e3toumomqtsz-0 start" start="3"><li class="c24"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.element14.com/community/docs/DOC-81966/l/43-lcd-display-cape-for-beaglebone-black&sa=D&ust=1558459985286000">element14 LCD Display Cape for BeagleBone Black</a></span></li><li class="c24"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://docs.macchina.cc/pb_adapter/&sa=D&ust=1558459985287000">Macchina M2 Adapter Board for PocketBeagle </a></span></li><li class="c24"><span><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DS2G78J&sa=D&ust=1558459985287000">DINrPlate for BeagleBone Black</a></span></li></ol><hr style="page-break-before:always;display:none;"><p class="c26 c28"><span class="c5"></span></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c62 c46"><span class="c11 c68">BeagleBoard.org Manufacturing Partners</span></h2>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 class="c64 c46" id="h.sti1k32wt9z"><span class="c47 c11">What is it</span></h2>
<p><span><img alt="http://beagleboard.org/static/images/beagle_approved.png" src="https://beagleboard.org/static/images/logos/logo/beagleboard-logo/beagleboard-logo.png" style="float: right; width: 314.48px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 20px;" title="">Partners in this program will manufacture official BeagleBoard.org products bearing the official BeagleBoard.org branding.  Becoming a manufacturing partner represents the highest level of partnership and commitment to the BeagleBoard.org Foundation.  Together we will work to shape the future of BeagleBoard.org by introducing new products to the market and improving the costing and proposition of current ones.</span></p>
